result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant's motion to modify bond.  Argument by Atty Fitzgerald/Argument by Atty Moeser

CASH BOND AMENDED - REFERRAL TO BMP
 - Cash bond is set in the amount of $250(per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 AM on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant is banned from south of Siggelkow Rd in the Village of McFarland, Dane County, WI.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Andrew W.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
